title: The movies to see this fall: 'Creed 2,' 'A Star is Born,' 'First Man' and more
chatter: A look at some of the top movies to hit theaters this fall.

title: Fall TV: From 'Murphy Brown' to Julia Roberts and everything in between
chatter: If we've learned anything from television, it's that dead doesn't necessarily mean dead.

title: Drake, Childish Gambino, Kurt Vile and more come to Philadelphia for concerts this fall
chatter: All the Philly area pop music worthy of recommendation, from now through the end of the year.

title: Terror Behind the Walls, Outfest, Philadelphia Marathon, and more special events for fall 2018
chatter: Also this fall: three big parades, two Oktoberfests, Halloween happenings, and a full slate of fall festivals

title: Philly fall theater: 'Once,' James iJames, 'Fiddler on the Roof,' punk vampires, 'Matilda,' more
chatter: Great musicals this season include "Fiddler on the Roof" and "Holiday Inn." Cutting-edge playwrights Dominique Morisseau, James iJames, and Lynn Nottage are in the mix, too.

title: Romeo and Juliet,' BalletX, Jessica Lang, and 12 more top picks for Philadelphia's fall dance season
chatter: Fall's dance season brings a new Pennsylvania Ballet "Romeo and Juliet," world premieres from BalletX, Philadanco at the Kimmel Center, and dancing all over the Barnes Foundation. Anna Deavere Smith visits for a dance-theater piece at Annenberg.

title: Comedy and stand-up shows coming to Philly this fall include Tracy Morgan, Wanda Sykes, Hasan Minhaj
chatter: It’s tough to find the humor in the 90-degree, 80-percent humidity dog days of a Philadelphia summer, but as days get shorter and the temperatures get lower, it’s time to laugh again.

title: Where to take your kids in Philadelphia this fall, from Thomas the Tank Engine at the Please Touch Museum to Boo at the Zoo
chatter: Halloween outings include "Witches and Wizards" in Chestnut Hill, Boo at the Zoo, and trick-or-treat every October weekend at the Academy of Natural Sciences.

title: Patricia Racette at O18, Black Violin at the Merriam, Philadelphia Orchestra plays the full 'Amahl'
chatter: Opera Philadelphia's O18 festival, free Philadelphia Orchestra concerts, and fast, daring trumpet work by Rodney Marsalis are three highlights.

title: Philadelphia's art museums feature Dior, Berthe Morisot, Winslow Homer, more
chatter: Lavish designer fashions and master works by female artists are the must-sees in Philadelphia museums this fall.

title: At the Parkway museums and beyond: Vikings, Rube Goldberg, a diorama reboot, and flu shots at the Mütter
chatter: The Franklin Institute goes Norse, the Academy of Natural Sciences spruces up, and in a Philly museums first, the Mutter Museum will offer flu shots. "Cotton" at the African American Museum of History in Philadelphia is another hot ticket.

title: A masterful Gee's Bend quilter and much more to see in Philly art galleries this season
chatter: The eye-popping quilts of Mary Lee Bendolph, a new take on the Wharton Esherick studio, activism via pottery at Clay Studio, and more

title: What to read this fall: Michelle Obama, Stephen King, Lin Manuel Miranda's 'Little Pep Talks,' more
chatter: Michelle Obama's "Becoming" is easily one of the year's biggest titles. Plus 28 more great reads for fall.

title: Book talks in Philly this fall: Tom Hanks, Jennifer Egan, Barbara Kingsolver, Jeff Tweedy, the 'Evan Hansen' crew ... and John Cena
chatter: Visiting authors will discuss a vast range of topics, from "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood" to our politically turbulent times, and of course the Eagles and Super Bowl LII. Best-selling novelists coming to town include Jennifer Egan, Gary Shteyngart, and Barbara Kingsolver.
